titleInfo.title: 319HA1 Dallas Site 8HA1, Hamilton County, Tennessee. Mound. Section of puddled clay ledge between the floor and bench of Feature 14 (Referred to in notes as Feature 20). Direction west

mods.abstract: [Feature 14]This structure formed the base of the mound. Over it was fill and rubble. Just above the feature and lying on the floor was charred roof and wall material and fragments from daubed walls. Has an entrance on the south and east. See sheets for features 20, 21, 22, and 23. [Feature 20] This bench forms the outer portion of Feature 14, serving as a bench or couch surrounding the central floor and fireplace. It is unbroken except for entrance corridor on south edge is rounded and molded. Built on a framework of canes in usual daub manner. When found was covered with grass. (See sketch of Feature 14).
mods.note: Observer illustration on file at the institution. No record on file for this photograph. See also photographs 312HA1 [fhm00750], 313HA1 [fhm00751], 314HA1 [fhm00752], 315HA1 [fhm00753], 316HA1 [fhm00754], 317HA1 [fhm00755], 318HA1 [fhm00756], 323HA1 [fhm00758], 325HA1 [fhm00759], 326HA1 [fhm00760], 342 [fhm01119], 344HA1 [fhm01121], 347HA1 [fhm01123], 348HA1 [fhm01124], 349HA1 [fhm01125], 352HA1 [fhm01126], 353HA1 [fhm01127], HA1(A) [fhm01137], 696HA1 [fhm01946], 342HA1 [fhm02015], and 344HA1 [fhm02017].
